title.narrative: CHF 2015 - Reduce Household Food Insecurity and Improve Livelihoods of Newly Displaced Persons and Extremely Vulnerable Host Communities of Otash camp in South Darfur, and Kadugli in South Kordofan States

description.narrative: The proposed project is designed to directly contribute to the FSL sector’s first countrywide strategic objective; Reduce acute food insecurity [SSO1– Saving Lives] targeting a total of 12,900 IDPs and extremely vulnerable host community in Otash camp in South Darfur and Kadugli in South Kordofan states. The project objective is to reduce acute food insecurity and address the most immediate needs of 12,150 beneficiaries and enable them to produce their own food and achieve self-reliance. This will be achieved through direct provision of agricultural inputs (seeds and tools). To ensure that the project objective is fully met, beneficiaries will also be provided with intensive skill training focusing on improved/adaptive agricultural practices, as well as provision of critical animal health services (vaccination). These interventions will contribute directly to the reduction of acute food insecurity in the short term, while building resilience and protect farmers against shocks in the longer term To enhance community ownership and collaboration and also ensure sustainability, the project will adopt a “Pass On” strategy where seeds are offered as an in-kind loan and each beneficiary is required to return an equal amount of seeds after harvest to a community – managed seed bank. The seed bank will then be able to loan seeds to additional farmers in the next planting season, hence multiplying the number of vulnerable families having access to seeds. Access to seeds is a major impediment to crop production and by adopting such a strategy, the affected vulnerable families will have a reliable and sustainable supply of seeds.
